intro: Isocarpha atriplicifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open woods and along stream banks, preferring moist, well-drained soils. It produces small, purple to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture.
